page.title: 01East Kilbride (North Area)
page.content: The area is largely made up of the northern half of the New Town of East Kilbride and its Green Belt. A variety of land use is present. The urban area consists of the main shopping centre, smaller shopping areas, the old vil- lage, New Town housing, recreation, and industrial estates. The rural area is mostly farmland with only a small hamlet at Kittochside and a few hist- orical buildings. The town lies in a hollow between 150-170m whilst the Green Belt extends from 170-200m on the gently sloping Cathkin Braes to the north. Land use (as %):-farmland (50.91), housing (13),industry (12.23), other urban (8.31), woodland (7.23), unused (3.41), transport (3.33), shops and offices (1.5), mining and quarrying (0.08)
